Subject: Hacking Outside the Box: Internet of Things
Description: With the emergence of the Internet of Things, pretty much everything you use on a daily basis -- from your car, to your thermometer, to your pacemaker -- are vulnerable to attack.  Are manufacturers of these non-typical computing devices using good security methodology?  Can you fool a car into unlocking itself with a simple setup?  What other fun devices have computers that can be fiddled with for fun or profit?  Speakers include:Nick Farr, Jason Kridner - Track: Tech  - Duration: 50 minutes - Audio/video needs: none

Subject: Getting Started with BeagleBone
Description: This hands-on workshop shows you how to take a BeagleBone Black, an open hardware computer that runs off your laptop's USB port, from out-of-the-box to blinking an LED in under 5 minutes. We'll get you to the Linux command prompt and introduce you to programming electronics with JavaScript. Bring a laptop if you can! Spots are limited - please sign up at Ops!  Speakers include:Jason Kridner, Christine Long - Track: Tech, DIY  - Duration: 50 minutes - Audio/video needs: none

Subject: Independent SW/HW: Bucking Big Industry for Fun and Profit
Description: Sure, there are juggernauts in software and hardware industry, but if you want to do it yourself, what kinds of challenges are you going to run into?  Come listen to our panelists talk about their experiences with going against the grain as independent software and hardware producers.    Speakers include:Aral Balkan, Ed Mason, Jason Kridner - Track: Tech  - Duration: 50 minutes - Audio/video needs: none
